conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C using the formula W = ∫ P dV.
In a p-V diagram, work can be found as the area under the curve; for constant pressure, it's a rectangle.
Pressure from state B to C is constant at 2 x 10^5 Pa; initial volume V_B is 2 x 10^-3 m³; final volume V_C is 3 x 10^-3 m³.
Calculate work done using W = P ΔV where ΔV = V_C - V_B.
The work done by the gas from state B to state C is 200 J.
